tasks.task: Drive a tractor with two front wheels
subtasks: Sit on tractor seat
Use handbrake
Operate steering wheel with both hands
Engage gears with clutch pedal
Manipulate throttle controls
Adjust seat and mirrors for visibility

tasks.task: Tend crops in front of tractor
subtasks: Walk alongside tractor in rows
Bend over to check crop health
Reach between crop rows to sample plants
Bend down to inspect soil and roots
Lift small dirt clods towards the front of the tractor using a tool (assumedly a shovel or hoe)
Hold the tool while walking
Deposit soil samples onto the tractor seat (the narrator mentions dumping compost, which would involve similar movements)

tasks.task: Apply compost to crops
subtasks: Load compost into tractor bucket or spreader
Drive tractor over fields while spreading compost
Use arm to guide the spreader or bucket
Shudder (possibly adjusting the spreader or checking spread pattern, although 'shudder' might indicate a sudden movement or adjusting the machine)

tasks.task: Maintain equipment
subtasks: Check fluid levels (oil, coolant, etc.)
Lubricate moving parts
Inspect tires for wear and air pressure
Tighten loose bolts or nuts
Clean exterior of tractor (though this might be done with a cloth, physical effort is involved)
Adjust seating and controls for personal comfort and efficiency

tasks.task: Adjust tractor attachments
subtasks: Remove or attach implements like a tiller or plow using hydraulic or mechanical pins
Manipulate levers or switches to lower or raise the attachment
Fasten or unfasten the attachment using tools or physical strength
Inspect the attachment for proper engagement and stability

tasks.task: Start the tractor
subtasks: Toggle key or switch to start engine
Check for any unusual engine sounds

tasks.task: Address issues or emergencies
subtasks: Stop the tractor safely in case of machinery failure
Turn off the engine and apply the handbrake
Check the problem (e.g., a hydraulic leak, stuck implement)
Make necessary repairs, which might involve disassembling components, applying force to parts, or accessing internal systems with tools

tasks.task: Prepare fields (though not explicitly stated in the transcript, preparing fields often involves tilling)
subtasks: Activate the tiller or plow attachment
Drive tractor through the field to till the soil
Monitor the depth and uniformity of tilling

tasks.task: Manage crop rows (if it's a planting or harvesting task)
subtasks: Guide the tractor along the rows with the operator's hands on the steering wheel for precision
Adjust the firearm (likely a mechanical device for planting or applying substances to the crops) as needed
Collect data or perform spot checks along the rows (e.g., checking for proper seed depth or evenness)

tasks.task: Verifying crop growth by using measuring stick or similar tool
subtasks: Extending a stick straight out towards the crop
Hold the stick level and mark the height next to it
Compare different plants to see growth variance
Take notes or make marks on the stick

tasks.task: Use of hand signals or check-in after extended time driving the tractor
subtasks: Wiggle arms or make hand signals to communicate with other workers or observers from the tractor seat
Alternatively, check in after several hours of driving to make sure nothing is wrong

tasks.task: Disembark tractor safely
subtasks: Apply the handbrake
Check the terrain for stability before exiting the tractor
Get off the tractor carefully, considering balance and the slope of the field
